Package ss.pentago.tui.menu

Class TUIInputField

  • java.lang.Object
    • ss.pentago.tui.menu.TUIInputField
  • public class TUIInputField
extends java.lang.Object
    TUIInputField provides a convenient way to group together to ask the user for certain input in startup and configuration menus, not gameplay input. This class provides methods to ask for a string, an integer, and a boolean (a 'yes/no' question).

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • askForString

        public static java.lang.String askForString​(java.lang.String question,
                                            java.lang.String defaultValue,
                                            java.util.Scanner scanner)
        Ask for a string.
        Parameters:
        question - the question, if null, defaults to "Text?"
        defaultValue - the default value
        scanner - the scanner
        Returns:
        the entered string, or defaultValue when 'Enter' has been pressed, or null when no input can be obtained (scanner is null) and the default is null or default when the scanner is null but not the default

      • askForNumber

        public static int askForNumber​(java.lang.String question,
                               int min,
                               int max,
                               int defaultValue,
                               java.util.Scanner scanner)
        Ask the user for a number.
        Parameters:
        question - the question, if null, defaults to "Number?"
        min - the minimum amount (inclusive)
        max - the maximum amount (exclusive)
        defaultValue - the default amount to use, if this value is smaller than min or bigger than or equal to max, it is set to min
        scanner - the scanner
        Returns:
        a number between min and max (exclusive), or defaultValue when 'Enter' has been pressed or max >= min or scanner is null

      • askForBoolean

        public static boolean askForBoolean​(java.lang.String question,
                                    boolean defaultValue,
                                    java.util.Scanner scanner)
        Ask the user for a boolean value.
        Parameters:
        question - the yes/no question, if null defaults to "Yes/no?"
        defaultValue - the default value to use
        scanner - the scanner
        Returns:
        defaultValue when 'Enter' has been pressed, true/false otherwise

      • waitForEnter

        public static void waitForEnter​(java.lang.String message,
                                java.util.Scanner scanner)
        Ask the user to press enter. This method exits when enter has been pressed.
        Parameters:
        message - the message to show them, if null defaults to "Press 'Enter'"
        scanner - the scanner
